Dear Ms. Aufdemberge:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
July 13 & 25, 2022. Due to the violation, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing statutes/rules are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (734) 395-0920.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4156 Institutions not detention institutions or shelter care
institutions; updated treatment plan.
(3) The updated treatment plan shall include all of the
following information:
(a) Dates, persons contacted, type of contact, and place
of contact.
Three of nine UTPs did not include all collateral contacts made
by the social service worker during the identified time frame or
all of the elements listed in subpart (a).
2.) The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
None offered at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
The Talent Acquisition Coordinator requested consultation on ways to handle a
newly hired transgender female staff, who has not transitioned, being alone with
female youth so as to maintain safety for both the youth and staff. Ideas were
exchanged.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Restraints and seclusions decreased significantly since the last licensing period -
restraints from 49 to 20, seclusions from 125 to 76.
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
4

There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
There were no investigations requiring corrective action plans during this
licensing period. Therefore, no corrective action plans were submitted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes or rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
